organic_results.title: Segmented labor markets in institutions of higher learning
organic_results.snippet: This article consists of an application of segmented labor market theorizing to the work domain of college and university teaching. Secondary analyses of the Carnegie Commission's 1969 National Surveys of Higher Education--Faculty Study Subsample and Statistics Canada's Full-time University Teacher's File, 1977-78 to 1986-87 and a selected review of the literature are used to present a portrait of those in the external labor market (who teach outside tenure or tenure-stream appointments). This portrait includes …
